fields.summary: Large lists of possible matches in all autocomplete-enabled fields should show all of them, instead of "x more options. Continue typing to refine further"

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-30830].
  {panel}

Sadly it seems that importing attachments in OnDemand using http fails. What's also odd is that I have a regular Apache webserver I can use to provide attachment files, and this works in the browser (including directory contents). Accessing the file using the Java code in HttpDownloader.java from my machine is fine, but from an OnDemand server I get a 403 error. Weird.

The attached file contains the minimal set of code to test access to attachments using http. I don't have permission to run it on an atlassian.net server to confirm the failure.

h3. Update

The attachments to be imported should be available via 80 (http) or 443 (https) ports. Our OnDemand instnaces are blocking outgoing connections on all ports other than those.
fields.summary: Attachment import not working with OnDemand

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-30828].
  {panel}

Improvement request:

For example, attached is what is at the top of the dialog when I close an Issue. It says, "Closing an issue indicates that there is no more work to be done on it, and that it has been verified as complete."

That is a pretty good generic description. But in our workflow, we differentiate between Closing an Issue and Resolving an Issue. In our use, "Closing" means we are not going to do any thing about the Issue.

I want to be able to change that text to better prompt the user.

I am told I can change it here: /atlassian-jira/WEB-INF/classes/com/atlassian/jira/web/action/JiraWebActionSupport.properties

But that's not a good approach if for no other reason than it is hard to do and prone to getting overwritten with a JIRA update.

I would like this ability for all of these text strings. For example, I would like to change the text for the Resolve step too.
fields.summary: As an administrator I want to be able to customize the text that appears at the top of the workflow dialogs

fields.summary: Jira shuts down and we loose data done

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-30795].
  {panel}

1) Go to KA basic search on JDog.
2) Add the "Rank" or "Global Rank" field as criteria.
3) Click on the new field.

You get an empty dropdown:
!Rank.png!

I've marked this as Minor because this searcher doesn't work in either Classic or KA in advanced mode - e.g. "Rank = 15475" returns no results on JDog, even though displaying the Rank column shows there is an issue with that rank.
fields.summary: GreenHopper rank field displays a blank searcher in KA

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-30790].
  {panel}

Steps to replicate:
# Create a comment handler from JIRA Incoming Mail Service
# Use MsOutlook 2010 and create an email to comment on an issue.  The content of the message contains newline:
!outlook.PNG!
# When the email's content is captured and added as a comment, the content places a newline with additional empty new line
!comment.png!
fields.summary: JIRA is not able to handle the MsOutlook content with a newline
Add language support to JIRA Calendar Plugin

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-30787].
  {panel}

We'd like to get information in our emails showing why the recipient is receiving the email. By this, I mean showing the recipient what their relationship to the issue is, in the email contents. This can have tremendous value in larger teams, as a recipient's understanding of their relationship drives the decision of how to react to the issue event. It also has the nice effect of providing a mechanism for fast-filtering of different types of email notifications - e.g. if a user has email folders for "My Issues", "My Watched Issues", "My Reported Issues", etc.

To clarify in terms of user stories, this is what we want:
* As a user receiving an email notification for an issue event, I can immediately gather my relationship to the issue in the email contents.
* As a user receiving an email notification for an issue event, I only see one relationship.
** Ideally the most "direct" relationship to the issue is chosen.
** E.g., If the recipient is both the issue's Assignee and in a project role configured to receive all notifications for that issue's project, the relationship in the email notification should be "Assignee".
fields.summary: Add "Notification Role" to mail notification
Need ability to have available field values be driven by selection from another field

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-30784].
  {panel}

With permission helper, this should guide user whereby to determine which user have which permission to have action on Issues.
However, with User Custom Field Value on Create Issue Permission, the permission helper is misleading.

Use Case
With configuration:-
!1.PNG!

With Permission helper:-
!3.PNG!

However, user admin still can create issue.
fields.summary: Permission Helper : Wrong information

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-30783].
  {panel}

When the Create Issue Permission granted to "User Custom Field" or "Reporter" or "Group Custom Field Value". 
This mean the Create Issue had been granted to *ANYONE*. 

Use Case:-
When A project permission scheme of Create Issue is ONLY granted to "User Custom Field Value"
* !1.PNG|thumbnail!

Where the custom have no default or predefined User selected
* !2.PNG|thumbnail!

Result:-
*ANYONE* can create issue which is not expected


Suggestion:
Disable or warn user when User choose Reporter or "User Custom Field" or "Group Custom Field Value" that this indicates *Anyone*
fields.summary: Unexpected behaviour in Create Issue Permission with User custom field

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-30782].
  {panel}

We are running JIRA 5.1.2. The following lists are not alphabetically sorted which makes administration a real drag:
* Statuses
* Issue Types
* Issue Type Schemes

As far as I can see in 5.2 you guys have fixed that for Issue Types. However, Statuses and Issue Type Schemes are still not sorted.

Can you please sort those tables alphabetically!
fields.summary: Sorted lists in admin interface
Being able to create remote issue links in the Comments
Refine Managing Shared Filters documentation page
Documentation - About 'Legacy Mode'

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-30777].
  {panel}

When the language configured in JIRA is different with the Machine OS, exporting filter to excel will cause the date mismatch in term of format and display.

JIRA should parse the Date format in number(perhaps something) rather than the date as the Excel will use the Regional Language in the Machine. 

Example:-
JIRA's Language = English
!im2.PNG!
Machine OS's Language = Dutch (Belgium)
!im3.PNG!
When exporting Date Custom Field in JIRA which is supposed to be dd/MMM/yy
!im1.PNG!

Result:-
!im4.PNG!
Expected Result:-
The Date in Excel should all be consistence but due to some conversion made by Excel based on Regional Language of OS's Language.

Workaround:-
Set the same language in JIRA and the OS

Suggestion:-
Parse the date as number instead of MMM?
fields.summary: Inconsistency date Export using Date Custom Field with different Language Configured

fields.summary: IE8 Layout Overlaps with Date Picker on JIRA 4.4.1

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-30765].
  {panel}

The attachments POST resource in the REST API (http://docs.atlassian.com/jira/REST/latest/#id255514) takes a file argument that contains the data, but no other parameters such as:

attachment filename
attachment creation date
attachment author

This means that attachments added this way appear ugly - just a long filename and no author or date. The long filename is the name of the file as it was on my local machine, e.g. "/Users/mdoar/..."

Why would I use this REST resource anyway? CSV import of attachments into OnDemand was not working so I to upload the attachments separately.
fields.summary: Add ability to set attachment name and other properties when using REST to add an attachment
Web Dev
Add the ability to switch users back and forth between using LDAP and JIRA Internal Directory

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-30755].
  {panel}

It's possible for us to integrate JIRA and Bamboo, and link a JIRA project version to a Bamboo build. 

However according to the [related documentation|https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/JIRA/Running+a+Bamboo+Build+when+Releasing+a+Version], it's only possible for us to link a version to Build that is not yet completed (in progress or paused at optional stage). And due to this, we are not able to link a version to a completed build.

Due to some requirement, we may need to link a new JIRA version to a completed build. Hence it will be great if we have the ability to link version to a build that has been completed in Bamboo.

!scshot1.png!
fields.summary: Add the ability to link JIRA version to a completed build in Bamboo
Improve speed of dashboard

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-30751].
  {panel}

When navigate the issue, especially useful for :-
- "Assigned to me" Gadget.

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-30750].
  {panel}

*Scenario*

+Case 1+:
I want to add few links to one issue.

Click button "Link"
Choose "relates to"
Start typing existing ID in the field "Issues" - "LG-6001"
Choose value from tooltip list
Repeat the action with other existing ID
Start typing existing ID in the field "Issues" - "LG-6001"

Expected result: System says something like "issue already added in haystack"
Actual result: They can repeat with no warning/error messages.

+Case 2+:
I want to add link to one issue, but don't know that issue already linked with the same relation.
Click button "Link"
Choose "relates to"
Start typing existing ID, in the field "Issues" - "LG-6001"

Expected result: System will say, that link already exists
Actual result: System allows me to add the link

+Case 3+:
I want to add link to two issue, but made mistake during typing. Last issue in the project LG-6255.
Click button "Link"
Choose "relates to"
Start typing not existing ID, in the field "Issues" - "LG-9999"
You will see "LG-9999 (Enter issue key)"
Choose value in tooltip
Start typing not existing ID, in the field "Issues" - "LG-700"
You may see "LG-700 (Enter issue key)"
Choose value in tooltip

Expected result: System says, that number is incorrect before i click to button "Link", because search fails, and system could know last number of the issue in project
Actual result: System allows me to add incorrect link before i click to button "Link" and correct link with the same behavior
fields.summary: Issue Linking Validation Improvement when relates to issue
The Advanced Settings should return error when the update failed

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-30747].
  {panel}

_Cause_

* ScreenshotApplet throws ClassNotFoundException (com.atlassian.jira.screenshot.applet.ScreehshotApplet.class) for some users 
* The following screenshot shows that users bump into the problem when try to attach a screenshot using the AttachScreenshotApplet. Attaching files directly works for them.
* This occurs when you have *Java 7* installed in the browser such as *Mozilla Firefox* or even *Microsoft Internet Explorer*
!applet_error.jpg!


_Workaround_
* Switch to *Java 6* and clear off the browser cache
fields.summary: ScreenshotApplet throws ClassNotFoundException (com.atlassian.jira.screenshot.applet.ScreehshotApplet.class)

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-30740].
  {panel}

The following feedback arrived from a dedicated customer of Atlassian:

{noformat}
The tutorial to be considered:
https://developer.atlassian.com/display/JIRADEV/Creating+a+Custom+Field+in+JIRA

Recognized issues:
The command atlas-create-jira-plugin-module gives other name for package
(com.example.plugins.tutorial.jira.jira.customfields)
creates a static final logger in moneycustomfield; (not mentioned in the
tutorial, that it would be there or that it should be removed or what else
should be done with)
gets wrong name class in src/test/java (MoneyCustomField instead of
MoneyCustomFieldTest)

The SDK can not build the plugin if you really follow the tutorial. For my
attempt to use the tutorial, I removed the logger, I renamed the class in
the test fork.

This are errors in the tutorial, however, I do not think that these are
causing my problem of the non-appearing customfield.
What I SUSPECT is that there are more errors in the tutorial which I could
not identify yet. E.g. I might need some kind of "searcher definition" or a
"link" that the standard text searcher is used for the moneycustomfield.
Or there are other things that must come along with a customfield plugin,
that are not covered in the tutorial.
{noformat}

Can we please have a check in case there is something misleading on that page?
fields.summary: Creating a Custom Field in JIRA dev tutorial refining
As a product manager i would like to assign additional (custom) fields (e.g. some date fields) to a version

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-30737].
  {panel}

The "top" objectclass is a obstruct class in LDAP which suppose not to be use as the object filter when setting up the LDAP user directory. But in case that it is using, the synchronization will be failed with the following error message: 
{noformat}
2012-11-28 11:56:21,332 QuartzWorker-1 DEBUG ServiceRunner     [atlassian.crowd.directory.SpringLDAPConnector] Performing group search: baseDN = ou=groups,o=jira,dc=momo,dc=com - filter = (objectclass=top)
2012-11-28 11:56:21,334 QuartzWorker-1 FATAL ServiceRunner     [ldap.mapper.entity.LDAPGroupAttributesMapper] The following record does not have a groupname: {ou=ou: groups, objectclass=objectClass: organizationalUnit, top}
2012-11-28 11:56:21,335 QuartzWorker-1 INFO ServiceRunner     [atlassian.crowd.directory.DbCachingRemoteDirectory] failed synchronisation complete in [ 14ms ]
2012-11-28 11:56:21,371 QuartzWorker-1 ERROR ServiceRunner     [atlassian.crowd.directory.DbCachingDirectoryPoller] Error occurred while refreshing the cache for directory [ 10000 ].
com.atlassian.crowd.exception.OperationFailedException: org.springframework.ldap.UncategorizedLdapException: Unable to find the groupname of the principal.
	at com.atlassian.crowd.directory.SpringLDAPConnector.searchEntitiesWithRequestControls(SpringLDAPConnector.java:416)
	at com.atlassian.crowd.directory.SpringLDAPConnector.searchEntities(SpringLDAPConnector.java:384)
	at com.atlassian.crowd.directory.SpringLDAPConnector.searchGroupObjectsOfSpecifiedGroupType(SpringLDAPConnector.java:1079)
	at com.atlassian.crowd.directory.SpringLDAPConnector.searchGroupObjects(SpringLDAPConnector.java:1127)
	at com.atlassian.crowd.directory.SpringLDAPConnector.searchGroups(SpringLDAPConnector.java:1136)
	at com.atlassian.crowd.directory.ldap.cache.RemoteDirectoryCacheRefresher.findAllRemoteGroups(RemoteDirectoryCacheRefresher.java:50)
	at com.atlassian.crowd.directory.ldap.cache.RemoteDirectoryCacheRefresher.synchroniseAllGroups(RemoteDirectoryCacheRefresher.java:74)
	at com.atlassian.crowd.directory.ldap.cache.AbstractCacheRefresher.synchroniseAll(AbstractCacheRefresher.java:42)
	at com.atlassian.crowd.directory.DbCachingRemoteDirectory.synchroniseCache(DbCachingRemoteDirectory.java:619)
	at com.atlassian.crowd.manager.directory.DirectorySynchroniserImpl.synchronise(DirectorySynchroniserImpl.java:63)
	at com.atlassian.crowd.directory.DbCachingDirectoryPoller.pollChanges(DbCachingDirectoryPoller.java:50)
	at com.atlassian.crowd.manager.directory.monitor.poller.DirectoryPollerJob.execute(DirectoryPollerJob.java:34)
	at org.quartz.core.JobRunShell.run(JobRunShell.java:195)
	at com.atlassian.multitenant.quartz.MultiTenantThreadPool$MultiTenantRunnable.run(MultiTenantThreadPool.java:72)
	at org.quartz.simpl.SimpleThreadPool$WorkerThread.run(SimpleThreadPool.java:520)
Caused by: org.springframework.ldap.UncategorizedLdapException: Unable to find the groupname of the principal.
	at com.atlassian.crowd.directory.ldap.mapper.entity.LDAPGroupAttributesMapper.getGroupNameFromAttributes(LDAPGroupAttributesMapper.java:148)
	at com.atlassian.crowd.directory.ldap.mapper.entity.LDAPGroupAttributesMapper.mapGroupFromAttributes(LDAPGroupAttributesMapper.java:109)
	at com.atlassian.crowd.directory.ldap.mapper.GroupContextMapper.mapFromContext(GroupContextMapper.java:53)
	at org.springframework.ldap.core.ContextMapperCallbackHandler.getObjectFromNameClassPair(ContextMapperCallbackHandler.java:67)
	at org.springframework.ldap.core.CollectingNameClassPairCallbackHandler.handleNameClassPair(CollectingNameClassPairCallbackHandler.java:50)
	at org.springframework.ldap.core.LdapTemplate.search(LdapTemplate.java:297)
	at org.springframework.ldap.core.LdapTemplate.search(LdapTemplate.java:237)
	at org.springframework.ldap.core.LdapTemplate.search(LdapTemplate.java:624)
	at org.springframework.ldap.core.LdapTemplate.search(LdapTemplate.java:535)
	at com.atlassian.crowd.directory.ldap.LdapTemplateWithClassLoaderWrapper$1.call(LdapTemplateWithClassLoaderWrapper.java:56)
	at com.atlassian.crowd.directory.ldap.LdapTemplateWithClassLoaderWrapper$1.call(LdapTemplateWithClassLoaderWrapper.java:53)
	at com.atlassian.crowd.directory.ldap.LdapTemplateWithClassLoaderWrapper.invokeWithContextClassLoader(LdapTemplateWithClassLoaderWrapper.java:43)
	at com.atlassian.crowd.directory.ldap.LdapTemplateWithClassLoaderWrapper.search(LdapTemplateWithClassLoaderWrapper.java:53)
	at com.atlassian.crowd.directory.SpringLDAPConnector.searchEntitiesWithRequestControls(SpringLDAPConnector.java:412)
	... 14 more
{noformat}
This is not clear for the user to identified the root cause of the issue. 

We should : 
# Warn the user in the documentation. 
# Make a tips in the objectclass filter area
# Have a clear error message instead of fatal error.
fields.summary: Better handler the error when using "top" as objectclass filter in the LDAP user directory settings
Retain fields selected under More Criteria in JIRA issue navigator
don't show the weekends

fields.description:
I have a standard setup, so in my opinion such problem should never happen. 

So, I have no plugins, no custom changes (althoug I'm using JIRA along with FishEye). I'm using embedded database. 

I've downloaded installer for 32bit JIRA 5.2.1 and performed standard update-installation.

After that I cannot start JIRA as a service. I have following message (sorry, in German):

"Atlassian JIRA auf Lokaler Computer konnte nicht gestartet werden. Weitere Informationen finden Sie im Systemerignisprotokoll. [...].
Beziehen Sie sich auf den dienstspezifischen Fehlercode 0."

When I start JIRA with bin/start-jira.bat I have some exceptions:
java.util.logging.ErrorManager: 4
java.io.FileNotFoundException: C:\Program Files (x86)\Atlassian\JIRA\logs\access_log.2012-11-28 (Zugriff verweigert)

And also:
Unable to create and acquire lock file for jira.home directory 'C:\Program Files (x86)\Atlassian\Application Data\JIRA'.

I've set up also full-access for JIRA and Application Data directory for JIRA User, but did not help.

If you need any more info please contact me I'll provide any info you need.

System Details:
Windows 7 64bit (German version)
Java HotSpot 1.7.0_07 64-bit Server VM
fields.summary: Cannot start JIRA (32bit) after upgrading from 5.1.7 -> 5.2.1 (both 32bit) on 64bit Windows7 with 64bit Java

{color:red}* 
Cause: 
com.atlassian.crowd.exception.PasswordEncoderNotFoundException: The PasswordEncoder 'atlassian-security' was not found in the Internal Encoders list by the PasswordEncoderFactory *{color}  

I am working on an test environnement. I think that this error occured after disabling some plugins so I want to reactive that but I can't access no longer to the admin screen.

By advance, thank you for your help.

Juliette.

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-30724].
  {panel}

We have added the following to ./bin/setenv.sh:
  4 if [ -z $JIRA_HOME ]; then
  5 JIRA_HOME="/data/jira/jira.home"
  6 fi

This would allow to set another JIRA_HOME for test purposes before starting Tomcat:
$ export JIRA_HOME=/data/jira/jira.test
$ /opt/jira/current/bin/catalina.sh run

In this example Jira would start with JIRA_HOME set to /data/jira/jira.test, instead of /data/jira/jira.home which is the default in the file below.

By simply typing
$ unset JIRA_HOME
$ /opt/jira/current/bin/catalina.sh run
Jira would start with the default home again.

This makes using one binary installation for different test setups much easier.
fields.summary: Enhance setenv.sh (unix) so that JIRA_HOME can be set from outside
Custom Field cannot be added to search criteria unless relevant Issue Type is selected

fields.description:
JIRA Eclipse connector reports that RPC services are not available, however I can access WSDL from build-in Web Browser.

In our company JIRA is secured using Negotiate protocol, which is supported by Java6 out of the box. Thus UserID+Password are not necessary.

P.S. Greenshot JIRA plugin (http://getgreenshot.org/screenshots/01-installing-plugins-2/) is known to work OK.

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-30719].
  {panel}

Feedback from a customer: 

After re-indexing of JIRA is finished, user clicks the Acknowledge button and gets back to the Re-Indexing screen, with duration of the finished re-indexing displayed.

To me, the expected behavior would be to show a different screen, not the exact same when was before re-indexing. It is confusing. It makes you think that you need to do re-indexing again. Anything but this would work (e.g. redirect to home page).

(Alternatively, a message could be displayed to make it clear that the re-indexing was successful and the user can proceed with their work.)
fields.summary: Counter-intuitive behaviour after re-indexing

JIRA 5.2 is currently listing the mime-type for 'swf' as 'application/x-shockwave-flash2-preview'
It is correct on Confluence as 'application/x-shockwave-flash'

When I build the JIRA plugin I can see that these two files have the error
./target/container/tomcat6x/cargo-jira-home/webapps/jira/WEB-INF/classes/mime.types:application/x-shockwave-flash2-preview rf swf
./target/jira/webapp/WEB-INF/classes/mime.types:application/x-shockwave-flash2-preview rf swf

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-30715].
  {panel}

We depend heavily on the Filter Results dashboard gadget to build dashboards used by the entire business.

With the upgrade from 4.x to 5.x,  the default columns displayed in the Filter Results gadget seem to have changed from "lots" to "Issue Type, Key, Summary".  It's configurable on a per-gadget basis,  but manually updating hundreds of dashboards isn't feasible.

We'd like the ability to set the default fields for all gadgets -- via a UI control,  {{.properties}} file,  or any other supported means.

Alternatively,  consider https://marketplace.atlassian.com/plugins/at.celix.jira.plugins.column-order,  which simply reuses the settings from the Navigator and the Filter.
fields.summary: need ability to change default columns/order in the Filter Results dashboard gadget
When saving a filter, save the column configurations with it as well

http://javatester.org/version.html reports that the bundled Java version with OS X is 1.6.0_34

*workaround*
Use the flash version: https://marketplace.atlassian.com/plugins/com.atlassian.plugins.jira-html5-attach-images

  {panel}

When you perform a search in the Issue Navigator, you go to _Views > Charts_ and select one of this gadgets:

- GreenHopper Classic Cumulative Flow Chart
- GreenHopper Classic Hour Burndown Chart
- GreenHopper Classic Statistics Burndown Chart

They say *"Invalid Project"*, but it is confusing, since the project is not invalid at all. You need to click on the _cog_ and then 'Edit', so you can select a context for it and 'save'. After that, the chart will appear.

It supposed to automatically select a default context or at least show a message that helps the user to identify what is wrong in this screen.

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-30688].
  {panel}

When using telnet for imap you can write:
? login domain-abc/user-123/mailbox-456 pword
this way you can with a service account access another group/persons mailbox with the correct rights offcause.
But I can't make it to work for the IMAP setup in JIRA. If I write domain-abc/user-123/mailbox-456 in the username field i get an error when testing (authentication failed).
Can the IMAP JIRA implementation access a shared mailbox? and how to config?

h4. Workaround courtesy of [~david.dixon]:
[A3 BAD User is authenticated but not connected error message when using JIRA with Office365|https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/JIRAKB/A3+BAD+User+is+authenticated+but+not+connected+error+message+when+using+JIRA+with+Office365]

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-30687].
  {panel}

I like the label concept, because it is a powerful feature. The problem that I see is, that everybody can create his own label. In this case you have really fast really much labels. Okay, my suggestions is, to combine the "label-field" with "multi-list-field". 
The result is a own labels field, in that we can configure the possible labels. And just the administration can configure a set of possible labels. I think this makes sense, because labels are only powerfull if you know the keywords. But if everybody is allowed to create own key words, you will really fast lose the overview.

So it would be great if we have in the future all three custom-fields:
Labels, Multi-List and Multi-Label (or what ever :-))
fields.summary: Combine "Multi Select Field" and "Label Field"
The ability to order versions on Road Map gadget
Archiving a Project is mislabeled as it can be applied to OnDemand also

  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-30677].
  {panel}

In jira 5.1 Inline editing is very useful and it's a great way to save time. 
But we have a few field that run script in them and modify other field in result. 
Because those script doesn't run when inline edit occur, the other field is not updated. 

it would be a great option to have in the field configuration to select inline edit option there.
fields.summary: Allow to disable inline editing of specific field

fields.description:
After upgrading from Jira 4.4 to Jira 5.1 some of the filters we had defined in Jira 4.4 didn't exist anymore. I believe the reason for this problem is as follows:

- The filter 'People on leave' was created in the 4.4-version by the user cg2
- In order to share this filter with the group 'administration' the user cg2 was added to the group 'administration'
- After having shared the filter 'People on leave' with the group 'administration' the user cg2 has been removed from the group 'administration'
- When we made the upgrade to Jira 5.1 cg2 wasn't a member of the group 'administration' and therefore he had no permission to use the filter. I suppose that this was the reason why Jira didn't upgrade this filter to the new version.
fields.summary: Filters get lost on upgrading to a new Jira-version

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-30674].
  {panel}

Hello,

we have a Jira setup which allows for two different access paths to the application: 
- Intranet (www.pre-cip.domain.intern/jira)
- Internet (www.pre-cip.domain.de/jira)

Therefore the base URL in Jira is set to neither but instead to localhost:11641/jira

This works fine so far. However, we now found some cases in which links are not correctly re-written (preserve-host feature of webserver in front of the Jira-Tomcat):

In the activity stream on the Jira dashboard there is a link to an issue:
- http://localhost:11641/jira/browse/TES-1

In almost any other cases the URL is re-written correctly (e.g. on the "Issues" page)
- https://www.pre-cip.domain.de/jira/browse/TES-1

As it works as disired in most cases, I would say that this is a bug.

Kind regards,
Sebastian
fields.summary: Jira shows different URLs for the same link
Add the ability to share filters with groups if the filter's owner isn't member of that group
Workload pie

fields.description:
When I go into an issue screen, JIRA displays that the issue is resolved ("Finalizado", in our language). On the other hand, when I search for the issue in the "Search for Issues" menu, it shows that the issue is in a previous status ("Em Aprovação", in our case), which is wrong.
I would like to know a way to solve it, to display the same status in both screens.

Both status can be seen in the attached pictures.
fields.summary: Inconsistency while displaying issue status
Send notification emails when logged work exceeds original estimate
Show inactive projects in JIRA

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-30663].
  {panel}

Users like the "CHANGED" JQL search keyword but it is only available for few default JIRA field.
Users wish to expand this JQL to *all the fields* and *default custom fields* as in:-

- Date Picker
- Free Text Field
- Group Picker
- Labels
- Multi Group Picker
- Multi User Picker
- Project Picker
- Read-only Text Field
- Select List
- URL field
- Cascading Select
- Date Time
- Multi Checkboxes
- Multi Select
- Number Field
- Radio Buttons
- Single Version Picker
- Text Field 
- User Picker
- Version Picker
fields.summary: CHANGED JQL for built-in custom-field types and ALL JIRA's Field

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-30662].
  {panel}

*Steps to reproduce*
* Edit the line transition in workflow. For example, !EditWorkflow.PNG!
* Publish the workflow and view in Workflow Designer. The workflow display like this !ViewWorkflow.PNG! 

As a user, it will be great that the line transition is follow exactly the same of what user edit in Workflow Designer.
fields.summary: Line transition edited in Workflow doesn't match with Workflow Designer
